Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa

Class Replacement

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.Replacement
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener
public class Replacement
extends AbstractAlgorithm
This class provides an implementation of string replacement based on [Fang Yu, Tevfik Bultan, Marco Cova, Oscar H. Ibarra: Symbolic String Verification: An Automata-Based Approach. SPIN 2008: 306-324]. In this implementation, the empty string is not allowed in the pattern automaton. If the pattern automaton accepts the empty string, the empty string will be removed from the language of the pattern automaton automatically during the string replacement.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

    Constructs this object.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    FSA replace​(java.lang.Object source, java.lang.Object pattern, java.lang.Object replacement)
    Returns an automaton M for a source automaton M1, a pattern automaton M2, and a replacement automaton M3 such that L(M) = {w1 c1 w2 c2 … wk ck wk+1 | k > 0, w1 x1 w2 x2 … wk xk wk+1 ∈ L(M1), ∀ i, xi ∈ L(M2), wi does not contain any substring accepted by M2, ci ∈ L(M3)}.
    FSA replace​(FSA source, FSA pattern, FSA replacement)
    Returns an automaton M for a source automaton M1, a pattern automaton M2, and a replacement automaton M3 such that L(M) = {w1 c1 w2 c2 … wk ck wk+1 | k > 0, w1 x1 w2 x2 … wk xk wk+1 ∈ L(M1), ∀ i, xi ∈ L(M2), wi does not contain any substring accepted by M2, ci ∈ L(M3)}.

  • Method Details

    • replace

      public FSA replace​(FSA source, FSA pattern, FSA replacement)
      Returns an automaton M for a source automaton M1, a pattern automaton M2, and a replacement automaton M3 such that L(M) = {w1 c1 w2 c2 … wk ck wk+1 | k > 0, w1 x1 w2 x2 … wk xk wk+1 ∈ L(M1), ∀ i, xi ∈ L(M2), wi does not contain any substring accepted by M2, ci ∈ L(M3)}.
      Parameters:
      source - a source automaton
      pattern - a pattern automaton
      replacement - a replacement automaton
      Returns:
      an automaton that accepts the results of string replacement
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if source, pattern, or replacement is not a classic finite automaton with a classical alphabet and labels on transitions

    • replace

      public FSA replace​(java.lang.Object source, java.lang.Object pattern, java.lang.Object replacement)
      Returns an automaton M for a source automaton M1, a pattern automaton M2, and a replacement automaton M3 such that L(M) = {w1 c1 w2 c2 … wk ck wk+1 | k > 0, w1 x1 w2 x2 … wk xk wk+1 ∈ L(M1), ∀ i, xi ∈ L(M2), wi does not contain any substring accepted by M2, ci ∈ L(M3)}.
      Parameters:
      source - a classic finite automaton or a regular expression that represents the source
      pattern - a classic finite automaton or a regular expression that represents the pattern
      replacement - a classic finite automaton or a regular expression that represents the replacement
      Returns:
      an automaton that accepts the results of string replacement
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if source, pattern, or replacement is neither a classic finite automaton with a classical alphabet and labels on transitions nor a regular expression
